intro: Salsola controversa, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or upright growth habit, depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are generally fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments. Salsola controversa is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
